website_summaries.verdict: This ultra-stable cane features a small, steady quad-pod foot rather than a large 4" base.
pros: Accommodates most people between 5 and 6.5 feet tall
Much lighter and more compact than large base quad cane
Re-centers itself for maximum stability, allowing cane to stand independently
cons: Outer ring can slide on linoleum

customer_reviews.title: Good but once the bottom wears you'll need a whole new cane.
customer_reviews.text: This cane is very sturdy. I have had mine for a little over two years. The handle is comfortable to use. The strap broke off the second month of use. Be very careful if it gets knocked over because it will get dented and pieces of the metal will stick out. I used a nail file to smooth them down. The quad pod works well in the wet and snow but you can't replace the pads on it you have to replace the entire piece. For the price of the pod alone I could get a new cane.
customer_reviews.author: M.B. Frisbie

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Foot broke after 4 weeks foot separated from cane - second foot broke after 4 months - poor design - when this third one breaks I'll look for another cane from a different manufacturer. Very disappointing for something you need to rely on to walk.
customer_reviews.author: VL

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could give a higher review. But ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give a higher review. But, the outer ring on the bottom slips on linoleum. That is a real problem. So unless you put cane down at exactly the right angle, cane will fly out from under you.
customer_reviews.author: taionaa

customer_reviews.title: Buy spare base
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cane 2months ago to help me reduce the weight on my hip while I walk. Because of my hip condition, on my best day I walk 2000 steps and on an average day I walk about 1300-1400 steps. The cane was perfect and was usable on all terrains but last week the base suddenly cracked when I was on the stairs. I suggest buying spares for the base before you choose this product.
customer_reviews.author: Anil

customer_reviews.title: The "old" model of this cane was amazing. Solid construction and lasted me so long
customer_reviews.text: The "old" model of this cane was amazing. Solid construction and lasted me so long. I genuinely loved it. But It was getting worn out with normal wear and tear for me so I ordered another one to get a fresh one. I noticed it was a "new" model. Broke the base within 2 weeks after my last cane lasted me for a year+. Returned it and got another case and within a month the base broke again. DO NOT BUY THIS CANE. It used to be amazing but this new model is AWFUL. Please consider another cane
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Vigil

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and design makes this cane something to stay away from.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this cane for just six months and it has already become unusable. About four months after I received the cane, one of the rubber feet fell off while I was out of the house. A month after that I found the cane would no long stand upright because the rectangular plastic shell that acts as the stabilizer for the cane had become separated from the shaft body. This is clearly a poor design that traded material strength for cheaper production costs.
customer_reviews.author: NFAToysTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Price, Height Adjustable, Safe, Perfect. Every house needs at least one, just in case.
customer_reviews.text: This cane was exactly what I needed and the price cannot be beat for the quality. Another name brand cane was double the cost of this and it has the same functionality - adjustable height, safe, anti-slip bottom, and comfortable hand grip. I had a disc rupture in my low back (L5/S1) and this was the only way I could function for three months. I will never be without it, and I recommend you get one and keep it just in case. The one day wait I had for it when the injury occurred was an eternity when you are suffering. Sure wish I had one in the house prior to getting hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie

customer_reviews.title: I've got 2 broken unusable canes
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these canes with the thought that these would last me forever because you're supposed to be able to change the base when you need to. WRONG! They bottom were the base is screwed in is so tight that I broke 2 Allan wrenches trying to get the screw out! When I tried to contact their customer support via email as well as chat I was given the run for days. This is just bad business with a bad product that should have been amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Puja

customer_reviews.title: Nice cane
customer_reviews.text: I received my cane yesterday and started using it . The cane is well built and very sturdy. The grip is solid rubber and will hold up well. The cane is a little heaven than my last cane but is much better built. I am 6' 8" tall 250 pounds and I was able to adjust the Cane so it was comfortable for my height. The base seems very durable and seems to work good on all surfaces. When not in use the cane stands on the base so I do not have to lay it down. So far I am very pleased with the Hugo Mobility Quad pod offset cane. For the price it is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: jantom415

customer_reviews.title: Saved my life
customer_reviews.text: I got diagnosed with a rare disease that paralyzed me in 12 hours. I spent 4 months in a wheelchair and then miraculously my mobility started to improve. At some point, I was finally able to walk again but not without the help of a cane. That's why I purchased this product and it was exactly what I needed. It was more stable than regular cane and very lightweight. This worked out well for me in a time of great need.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: It really DOES stand up by itself - get this instead of the one advertised on TV. Great quality- you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Best cane I've ever had - and I've had a lot of them. It stands upright on carpet, concrete, grass and most other surfaces. The quality is great, the design is excellent, and I especially like the padded grip handle with contoured locations for your fingers. I'm 5' tall and was able to adjust it to a perfect height
customer_reviews.author: Luv2ShopOnline

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my mom , who has both knee and back issues. She had felt that the older models of canes with a wider base were both bulky and clumsy to use ( I agree) This cane gives her much greater stability than a standard small tip cane , and is still easy to use and travel with .
customer_reviews.author: tess

customer_reviews.title: We like it for a number of reasons
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this came for my 91 year old mother. In the past few months, he had started using a cane my dad had used, but then misplaced it while out & about. We like it for a number of reasons. This cane takes up less space than the 4 prong canes I looked at. So she's less likely to trip up on it. It still stands on its own when her hands need to be free. She's stated that she likes the bright pretty color & thinks it's more noticeable than the subtle grey one she had when it's time to move on. She loves it & has been asked several times by various friends where she purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Robeson

customer_reviews.title: Hugo Mobility Quadpod Offset Cane with Ultra...  Hugo Mobility
customer_reviews.text: I like the design and workmanship of the Hugo offset Cane. I bought the Tripod Offset cane also. But I find this model to be more to my liking. not as heavy as the other one I purchased in 2016. Like the ability to heighten & shorten the length of the Cane and for storage when in a car. I bought a replacement Quad Pod Base attachment for my cane . I dose stand by it self on carpet & Hard floors. I like that feature. This will my primary go to walking Cane for 2017 its 2020 , Need a new one and reorder the same one again. The old one served me well. Awesome. Recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Shihan

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item after my husband had a fall. He has used it for a few months. The cane is very light, and it's easy to use. We recently carried it on a plane trip and it collapsed and fit in the overhead compartment easily. The only reason I gave it 4 stars rather than 5 is because it does have a tendency to fall over and as he is injured my husband wasn't able to pick it back up.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: I thought this was going to be a top shelf ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be a top shelf handicap product but boy was I wrong. The guad pod has broken in two pieces at the base leaving the cane unable and dangerous to use after only owning it for just one month. Unless there is a warranty on this cane I guess I will have to shop elsewhere for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Bulbman

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Hugo cane
customer_reviews.text: My first one was wonderful. When I left it at a store and lost it, I didn't even think twice about ordering. It was prefect after many years. This replacement is very disappointing. I have had it less than 6 weeks and the tip is cracked and needs to be replaced. One of the feet is almost broken off and I don't know if I should replace it with the same tip. I do like the idea of the stand up tip but having to replace it every 6 weeks is going to get expensive. I will try it again but hope this last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Karen A

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. I purchased this cane five months ago, and the "quad" foot has broken away and left just the center rubber cap. It felt very stable before that happened and now it's wobbly. The return period was extremely short and now I am stuck paying for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette Holzer

customer_reviews.title: Stands on it own.
customer_reviews.text: My mil uses this can and so far it seems to work fine... even if she's carrying the cane rather than using it for some support. It does stand on it's own and doesn't feel wobbly at all. My Aunt has the hurry-cane that folds that there is a definite difference. It's probably because her cane is collapsible and this one is not. So can't really do a nice comparison. Overall since my mil is happy with the cane will give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Pat K

customer_reviews.title: I got some of my independence back!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first cane and I really like it. I bought this cane specifically for the quadpod on the bottom because it adds a lot of stability. Single tip canes aren't stable enough but the traditional quads made me feel like the elderly man from Up (I'm in my 20's). I have gained so much stability and independence with this cane. I use it for balance and weakness and the type of bottom on it helps so much. The handle, held the traditional way, is a little uncomfortable because of the bump but a slight adjustment in hand position adds comfort and stability. It is lightweight which is important when you lack strength. I also love the adjustable height.
customer_reviews.author: M Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Unlike myself, If you like a quad style this is well made
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Well made product -Weight to product ratio is proportionate, not as light weight as a non-quad cane but the like I said bf it is well made Cons: Quad part was a trip hazard for myself. Returned product bc of that reason. Gave 3 stars for sturdiness bc the quad piece did not help to sturdy me, but if you prefer the quad to a traditional I recommend this particular cane bc it is a good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: M Thomas

customer_reviews.title: If your idea of poor, is it lasts less than 2 months, you are right!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in April. By the end of May, it was broken. The foot completely separated from the cane tip. If I had been using it to fight dragons with, I could understand. I however, have other devices that I use to combat the leviathan. This was only used to support me while walking.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Ward

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy cane!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandmother and all the reviews and recommendations have been confirmed. She used to use her walker to get around the house because her old cane didn't feel sturdy enough. Now, with this cane, she hardly uses her walker about the house. This gives her the perfect amount of support and she feels a lot more stable. Apparently it's also got a good amount of grip on light ice/snow which she was super impressed with. Extra note, LOVE the color. It's a bit brighter than the pictures, perfect for an individual personality, had lots of compliments!
customer_reviews.author: J. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and Sturdy Cane
customer_reviews.text: The handle grip is really nice and the cane offers good stability, even for those with dizziness or vertigo. The height is also easy to adjust and the color is a beautiful, vivid blue! It's sturdy, it's stylish, and easy to use. My only complaint is that it makes a little bit of noise when using it, but it isn't a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: The grips is broad and comfortable. I have not had any hand pain while ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cane because my older canes were bruising my hand. I did not need another pain. The grips is broad and comfortable. I have not had any hand pain while using it. And I have found the ability for the cane to stand on its own to be a great convenience. I have a Hugo strollator that like, so the brand was familiar to me. I would recommend this cane to everyone
customer_reviews.author: Bill Perry

customer_reviews.title: It came apart
customer_reviews.text: bought this in April and it was as advertised. However on July 1 the quad pad came loose and as weight was put on it worked its way up the pole leaving the plastic "nut" on the bottom of the pole exposed. This created a dangerous situation as it not only could mar the wood floor but easily slips as well.
customer_reviews.author: RB in Tennessee

customer_reviews.title: Works and light weight!
customer_reviews.text: My husband who can’t walk unassisted bought this to stabilize himself going up the stairs. It is so light weight that he can hang it off the side of his walker, and it makes negligible difference in weight of the walker. It is very portable for taking along in the car and efficient at stabilizing his large frame.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Best cane that I have tried.
customer_reviews.text: My mother and I both got one of these as we each need added support to walk. We like the ergonomics of the handle. It is easy to hold and has some give, and it centers the hand over the stem section. Has held up well through lots of use and continues to look good. Great color and color choice. The biggest plus is that it stands by itself when you need to let go of it.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter Pie

customer_reviews.title: I love this cane
customer_reviews.text: I love this cane! I only have to use it to walk far distances and for stability in inclement weather, so I have bought 3 so far to keep in each one of our cars. I would never go back to a basic cane because this stands upright everywhere and anywhere, and I do not have to lay it on a vanity or the ground or lean it against something where it most likely will fall.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great cane.
customer_reviews.text: Good balance with this cane. I refuse to give up walking for exercize even though I have neuropathy and my right hip drives me nuts when I walk any distance. I take it with me on walks and it helps me balance and takes the strain of my hip joint. Used to walk 2+ miles everyday and am hoping to get up to that again. I'm 65 and will not give up my mobility this young(Probably hip replacement sooner rather than later).Anyway that said, I like this cane for balance and it's very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: K.  Howell

customer_reviews.title: Truly Innovative Cane
customer_reviews.text: To begin with, the cane comes fully assembled. The "quad pod" that is the foot, can be changed to a different position based on need. There was no need for us to change it. It's a simple thing to do if you need to. My husband had back surgery & with this cane he was able to get off the walker earlier. There is NO WAY he would have used a huge footed cane... you know the steel granny four legged cane. Not in public anyway. The physical therapists loved it. It got passed around while he was using a machine during therapy. I really think it's the next great thing!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Smith

customer_reviews.title: These were resolved rapidly and easily. It would appear that the originally shipped foot ...
customer_reviews.text: Had some initial issues with the tightness of the screw holding the head/foot tightly to the cane. These were resolved rapidly and easily. It would appear that the originally shipped foot had the hex hole punched off center causing the machinery to get it "almost" tight enough, the replacement foot has a properly centered and snug fitting hex hole and comes with a key (of the size I used to try to tighten the first one) to make sure the customer is not the problem as I feared I may be with some motor issues at the time.
customer_reviews.author: William Blaylock

customer_reviews.title: Handle is different then pictured. It is more narrow ...
customer_reviews.text: Handle is different then pictured. It is more narrow and is uncomfortable due to a ridge that sticks up and digs into your palm when you put your weight on it. I ordered two new canes to match my outfit fits for my sons upcoming wedding because my older one has scratches. I have to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Kahn

customer_reviews.title: No Replacement Bases
customer_reviews.text: My wife really liked this cane, however, the base broke after 3 months. Cane is useless. Since I am outside the return window I elected to purchase a replacement base. Amazon lists this product but it is unavailable. In fact, I can’t locate one anywhere. Frustrating! Consider this when deciding on your cane.
customer_reviews.author: Rick in Newnan Ga.

customer_reviews.title: Base needs redesign
customer_reviews.text: This cane is really lightweight and I thought I was purchasing a top quality product. I purchased what I thought was a high end cane for my Aunt to upgrade the old one she had. After only three months the base broke already. Now I see this is a issue with this cane as others are having the same problem. Think the base needs a redesign. Won’t be recommending this product!!
customer_reviews.author: sue Schweyer

customer_reviews.title: Not quality materials used
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight cane. That’s the only positive about this. Quad bottom did not provide stability and would often fall over when not in use. Not appropriate for long term use or heavy use. Have used this for about 3 weeks (not quite) and the base has already cracked in 5 places. User is 5’10” and 175lbs. Uses this lightly mostly around the house and uses crutches outside the house due to a broken ankle. Not a good purchase and would recommend looking at other brands.
customer_reviews.author: R Schaffner

customer_reviews.title: I love the cane and except for the fact it does ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the cane and except for the fact it does not fold up, it works just perfectly. Helps me to get up the stairs much better than the old hospital cane I used. Thrilled I go it. I have COPD so the less effort expended the easier it is for me to breath. I only mention this because I never thought that a cane could help me so much, but this one does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: A Solid Cane and a Real Bruiser (Literally):
customer_reviews.text: Cane is solid and secure and has both a nice finish and comfortable grip. BUT, the Quad tip is a real ankle bruiser that constantly slaps against your leg in normal use. The quad foot's heavy weight and shape makes the impacts painful and eventually colorful. Learning to use this cane in some special way might eventually eliminate the bruising, but I don't believe this should be required of a new owner/user to avert injury. We sent our back.
customer_reviews.author: NGBGnc

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME! Bought for my 92 yr
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! Bought for my 92 yr. old mom who is needing more support to walk. I love that the cane can stand on its own. The other one kept falling on my feet when we were out shopping, very pretty blue!
customer_reviews.author: honolulututu

customer_reviews.title: Great cane.
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth quad cane I have purchase for myself and friends. It is light and stands on its own. It adjusts well for people my height at 5 foot 4, to my friend's height at 6 foot 4". I have smoke and teal and my friend has the black. I would love to see it in purple and multi patterns.
customer_reviews.author: rosebud43

customer_reviews.title: It really does weigh less than four shape rubber tip canes!! :)
customer_reviews.text: Thank you!!! I love my cane!!! It really does weigh less than the canes with four shape rubber tip. I walk just fine with it and my arm doesn't get tired of lifting the cane!!! I love the beautiful blue color!! I wish they offered many more pretty colors!! (Hint,hint!) :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I hate that I had a need for this
customer_reviews.text: I hate that I had a need for this, but grateful in it's ability to assist me in transitioning from a walker. The quad base gave me the extra support I needed when I first began using it. And it's ability to stand without being propped against something is a plus. I've recovered enough that I won't require it much longer and plan on passing it on to the retirement home my mother lives in.
customer_reviews.author: Chandra Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage. Broke after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with this crap. Broke in less than 6 months. Didnt think that spending $30 on a cane meant it would break so quickly. I have hand carved wooden canes that have lasted years. Thought for $30 it would last years since I spent $20 on each of my wooden canes and got 5 times the lifespan out of them. Just garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I find cane very wobbly and not very sturdy when walking
customer_reviews.text: I find cane very wobbly and not very sturdy when walking. Wanted to return but was informed by Amazon that it is a nonreturnable item. Think a regular cane is sturdier and more solid. Someone told me not to buy one of these but I did not listen.
customer_reviews.author: dennis panek

customer_reviews.title: Product looks good, but the Quality is not there
customer_reviews.text: Bought in late May and Broke two months later. A flaw in the base, the 4 webs that hold it together broke losing its stability. Amazon did a great job and refunded my investment immediately. Very satisfied with Amazon. Would NOT recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: E. R. Blohm

customer_reviews.title: good stable cane.
customer_reviews.text: unfortunately the base doesn't last. first the web breaks down and squeak's. i suppose then it breaks as i have seen from others reviews. would be nice to find a replacement base, does anybody know where to find one.
customer_reviews.author: willi

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality control of pod foot design
customer_reviews.text: Hugo is having a problem with their rubber supplier quality control. The foot will break sooner than later. Great design but very poor quality control. Avoid this cane for others.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: helps a lot to walk Excellent
customer_reviews.text: if i go to an office i don't have to worry about where to lean my walking stick while i take care of business. this walking stick stands up and doesn't need to lean on something.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and Stable
customer_reviews.text: Lost my cane and was in need of a new one. The base is stable which is extremely important so I do not have another fall. The handel is comfortable. The color is bright and cheerful.
customer_reviews.author: Betty J Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Foot broke after 3 weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: I like the product and it is as advertised. The foot broke/split after only 3 weeks of intermittent use (maybe 20 hours). I bought a replacement foot which will hopefully last longer. Disappointed that this component broke so easily. While I am using it for assistive weight distribution, I only weigh 180 pounds so not like I'm really stressing it. Unfortunately, a split foot means that it doesn't provide the stability and support needed which makes it dangerous to use/rely on.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: My physical therapist did not like it.
customer_reviews.text: The PT lady bought me another cane on her own and took this one away. I did not see anything wrong with it and it was great because it could stand up on its own, but I acquiesced to the PT's choice.
customer_reviews.author: DENIS DELLALOGGIA

customer_reviews.title: Stability with cane
customer_reviews.text: Bought for an elderly man who is 101 years old and walks everyday but has started to need a little help with stability. The bottom footing is enough to give him the stability. The larger 4 prong footed cane is a too much of a trip hazard. this one is just right and the adjustable height made it even more attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Cats5

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: The cane does not give stability needed when elderly momma tried it out. We returned it. It Did not stand well except on even, non-inclined, hard surface. Don't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: wdarley

customer_reviews.title: Love this cane
customer_reviews.text: Love this cane! I was recovering from a broken ankle and used this cane after getting functional enough to stop using a walker. It was perfect! It stays standing so you can use both your hands like at the kitchen counter, light weight, and the base is not to bulky so you don't trip on it. Price was right as I knew it was only a temporary need. The only negative is having to use an allen wrench (which I was lucky enough to already own a set) and also how hard it was to turn. For someone who lives alone and doesn't have an allen wrench set, this may be an issue. Otherwise, I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kabitan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold up
customer_reviews.text: I’m 6’4” and it easily adjusted to my height. Comfortable handle. Update: I have had it 5 months, but only used it for 6 weeks. The cane foot broke in the same place other reviewers have shown in their pics. Just not built to last. I replaced just the foot with another brand that appears sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny K.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality. Nice job.
customer_reviews.text: This Hugo is one of the best canes on the market. That's my personal opinion. I have 6 canes. Two are Hugo. It's about like the Carex canes. Both are perfect for me. Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alyce

customer_reviews.title: Quad tip makes it very stable
customer_reviews.text: I like the quad tip on the bottom of the cane. It makes it very stable when walking. This is my first cane so I don't have anything to compare it to. I would have liked it to be able to fold it up since it is quite bulky when not in use. When you take it out to a restaurant it needs a seat to itself.
customer_reviews.author: viejo oso

customer_reviews.title: He Luvs it!
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my husband who's suffered a permanent back injury in the military. He's a proud man, he doesn't complain about aches and pains and he most certainly doesn't need any help with anything 😜 He's 6'3" and about 300lbs and he loves this cane so much, he had me order one for his brother as well 😊 it's made a huge difference by improving quality of life 😊
customer_reviews.author: Dean and Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Helped me get through rehab
customer_reviews.text: Very nice cane. It will stand up on its own. I really depended on it before and after surgery. It did exactly what I needed it to do. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna Rubeck

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it, but...
customer_reviews.text: This cane seemed like the perfect product, but after only two weeks the plastic quad pod base started splitting. As I continued using it the crack spread to all four sides. I discontinued using it and sent a contact message to the manufacturer but they haven't responded. Their site has a phone number so I'll try calling them for a warranty replacement.
customer_reviews.author: John Graves

customer_reviews.title: This cane is an excellent compromise between the conventional single-footed cane and the typical ...
customer_reviews.text: This cane is an excellent compromise between the conventional single-footed cane and the typical four-footed cane. The molded handle is more comfortable and more secure than the common foam variety. More importantly, the quad base is lighter and more maneuverable than the typical larger four-footed base. It is less likely to snag your foot or other objects. While it is less adept at standing alone than the larger four-footed types, but it does stand alone, making it much more convenient than the single-footed type. The cane arrives fully assembled and ready to use after you remove the tag.
customer_reviews.author: Clicker Guy

customer_reviews.title: More than satisfied. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This cane works great. Stands upright on uneven surfaces like carpet as well as even stuff like tile. Much Much Much better than the expensive HurryCane that I used to have - it would never stand upright on carpet or anything not perfectly even. The quad cane tip feels solid when i'm walking along. Also it doesn't look clunky like the big metal cane tips that really look ugly. More than satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: jawturbo

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous garbage
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this cane. Not only is it cheaply made and the base will break after a few uses, it is dangerous because you will fall and hurt yourself when it breaks unexpectedly. The base is cheap plastic that will snap while using the cane. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Emo

customer_reviews.title: Good cane but....
customer_reviews.text: I love these canes because of the stability and the fact it will stand alone. The one complaint I have is that 6 months after purchase on my last one the Quad/Pod broke. I could not remove it to replace it and new Quad/Pods were not available anyway. So I had to buy a new one. I use mine constantly.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Rymill

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This cane broke after the first couple weeks of using it. It actually broke when I was using it, which could have caused further injury.
customer_reviews.author: Km9999

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The "quad" foot is much more stable than a straight cane. I walk on all different surfaces & it always catches me & holds up those times when my knee buckles, no matter if I'm walking on gravel, dirt, concrete, grass, etc. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Best cane I have used.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best canes that I have ever used. The handle is very comfortable and it is convenient that the cane can stand by itself. Price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: isgold

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Color for a Wal;king Cane
customer_reviews.text: I chose the Hugo Quad Cane because it was the only cane that I could find for my 90 year old mother that didn't look like a piece of artillary. Why manufacturers and designers feel that help aids must look like weaponry is a wonder. The Hugo cans I picked is a lovely blue so it is easily sighted but not so bright as to shout out its purpose. The pods are small which works well for my 4'10" mom. other quad-like canes had wide pods that a small person would wasily trip on. As for standing on its own, it must be on a flat surface.
customer_reviews.author: Giggirl

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointing
customer_reviews.text: At First the cane was great, however after just 5 short months the base of the cane broke. I was expecting to get much more than 5 months of use. I weigh about 120 lbs and for the cane bottom to break in this way seems like extremely poor craftmanship.
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: The best cane.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second cane as I walked off and left the last one figured someone would call asI has my name and phone number but I guess they liked it too so I had ordered another one as I couldn't be without it even though I had 3 other canes .
customer_reviews.author: Cleo the lion

customer_reviews.title: My best cane...
customer_reviews.text: I love this cane. I bought one as a gift for my 93-year-old mother. This one is for a friend who admired mine. It is smaller than most quads at the bottom but easily stands on it’s own. I feel very secure and the color is beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Rocks!

customer_reviews.title: This worked out great. It stands well on small feet on its ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife's knee surgery. This worked out great. It stands well on small feet on its own and height is very adjustable for both large and small people. My wife is 64" tall. Price is good . Much better then ones sold locally at CVS or RightAid.
customer_reviews.author: George Martirosian

customer_reviews.title: It Holds Me Up!
customer_reviews.text: Nice color, which hasn't chipped yet. Quad foot is sturdy without being holy-shit-I'm-100-years-old grotesque. In fact, I think I'm a happenin' chick when I use this.
customer_reviews.author: DogsInSeattle

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a nice cane. It rarely falls over (unless someone bumps it). At first, it did fall quite often; but my husband was able to turn the base around for me, which seems to make it stand up better when I am not walking and it is easier for me to walk with. I am recovering from knee replacement surgery, so hope I won't have to use it much longer. I will keep it in a safe place in case my husband or I ever needs to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tess A.

customer_reviews.title: Great value and top quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Mother after she spent a few weeks in an inpatient rehab facility. This was very similar to the cane used in her physical therapy. It’s lightweight yet sturdy, so I feel confident that my Mom is safe when walking.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this Cane
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cane in black for my father and in turquoise for my mother. They are very pleased with the ergonomic handle,adjustable height, light weight, excellent grip,small foot and it's ability to stand up.
customer_reviews.author: Nancyj117

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my 70 year old mother whom ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 70 year old mother whom has been having issues with swollen feet and moving around. This has worked out very handy even though she still tries to walk for the most part without it.
customer_reviews.author: Raieo

customer_reviews.title: Fits 5 ft Tall Woman
customer_reviews.text: Mom loves it. She took a few frightening falls using her PREVIOUS cane because it would get stuck in cracks, and was less stable. She hasn't fallen once with this one! The "wide foot" keeps it from wedging in crevices. BEST FEATURE: it stands up when she isn't using it, so she doesn't have to have someone assist her in retrieving it from the floor. No, it does NOT pivot and it does NOT collapse - which we prefer. I believe this makes it more stable for her. Color is bright and cheerful, too. Less medical looking than the silver or black.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Crane

customer_reviews.title: Within a few months the cane may stop standing alone.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cane on April 5th 2019 and it's the 7th of August and it won't stand upright. I try tightening it on the bottom but it doesn't hold. It should last longer than 4 months. I'm disappointed. When it works it's a very nice cane.
customer_reviews.author: ladybj

customer_reviews.title: Stable and with a small footprint
customer_reviews.text: Love it! This replaced a tripod cane when the tip on that one split. This entire cane only cost $3 more than a replacement tip. Hugo has a good reputation. Stands much better than the one "as seen on TV" and still has a small footprint.
customer_reviews.author: hmmmingbird

customer_reviews.title: I am not nearly as pleased with this cane as I thought I would be
customer_reviews.text: I am not nearly as pleased with this cane as I thought I would be. its not stable at all outside, causing me to fall twice in a one week period. I will definitely not be recommendi9ng this cane to anyone!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stands up well on hard surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: It works fine. Stands up on hard surface. On carpets it has a tendency to fall sideways as the four feet are narrow. But wider feet would make it awkward for me to use without kicking the feet. It telescopes easily, & has a means to tighten the slop out so it is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Class Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Best to try out canes
customer_reviews.text: I think I would do better with a 3 lobe tip. This is heavy and with eye problems sometime I step on the tip.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Black

customer_reviews.title: Good cane overall
customer_reviews.text: Good cane overall, highly adjustable, lightweight. Rubber base broke after 8 months of average use. The cane tip now pokes through it. I am dissappointed!
customer_reviews.author: W. Norton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, handy, stable.
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this for my mom and she's very happy with it. She can pick it up easily if it falls over and it keeps her stable when she feels she needs support while walking. I like the color choices, too.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie E. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Would give it 6 stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: After blowing out my knee I needed a stability device while I was healing. I'm a 'heavy-duty" size person so I needed a sturdy cane to transition from a walker. I found this cane to be ideal. It easily takes my extra weight when I'm tired and lean on it. The grip is comfortable. The quad feet makes walking on uneven surfaces safer. And the colors are cool. That's what a kid at church told me anyway. LOL!
customer_reviews.author: CarrieChristy

customer_reviews.title: She calls it "the Cadillac of canes" and although she says it is so very sturdy she could defend herself with it (
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sister and she is absolutely thrilled with it! She calls it "the Cadillac of canes" and although she says it is so very sturdy she could defend herself with it (!), she almost hates to use it as it is so lovely. I bought her the blue, and she says it shimmers in the sun. Such a good deal, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bad quality. Not sturdy at all. I sent this to my Mother who is recovering of hip surgery. I had to return it. Not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Safe, Sturdy and Dependable.
customer_reviews.text: Second one I purchased— one to use inside, and one to keep in my car for use away from home. Very sturdy, and broader base adds safety.
customer_reviews.author: H Strauss

customer_reviews.title: Better than a hurrycane
customer_reviews.text: This is the best money I ever spent when my back was out, ten times better than a hurrycane
customer_reviews.author: David H. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Nice cane
customer_reviews.text: I had to wait 3 months before my hip replacement could be scheduled. And my hip was bone-on-bone the entire time--constant excruciating pain. Because my balance was off and putting full weight on that leg was so painful, I needed a cane. I was very happy with this cane. Easy to adjust, and it does stand by itself--mostly. Not always, of course, on carpet, but that was OK. I got it in this brown and also in turquoise. I highly recommend this cane, especially for temporary use.
customer_reviews.author: Avid reader in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Start out right with the Hugo cane that stands by itself
customer_reviews.text: Just others have said this cane is great because it does stand by itself and the "feet" are small enough so that you don't trip over them. Handle is comfortable and wrist strap is useful. I am glad I bought the hugo cane with the feet already attached. My cane old cane without feet kept falling down in the store and in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: goonebear

customer_reviews.title: He liked more than other brand but make noise
customer_reviews.text: He liked more than other brand but it make noise. I tried a small tape but didn’t work well. A lot of noise when hits the floor and when the 2 parts hits the silver bottom that make short or long cane.
customer_reviews.author: ⚜️Andrea⚜️

customer_reviews.title: It got great reveiws so I went with it
customer_reviews.text: Read several reviews before buying.It got great reveiws so I went with it. I,however, found it to be unsteady on carpet and I almost fell several times. Sadly, I bought two and they aren't eligible for return. Didn't think it would be an issue. Just can't recommend it from my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Morris

customer_reviews.title: New using a cane but this feels a LOT BETTER the the cane that I got from the hospital.
customer_reviews.text: IT'S GREAT, New using a cane but this feels a LOT BETTER the the cane that I got from the hospital. This can stand waiting for you to use it and the handle give me a more secure sense of support, and it is easier on my hand.
customer_reviews.author: D. at LLRC

customer_reviews.title: Tips to adjust base
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but read on to adjust base. Marks review on 4-18-13 was very helpful. The base arrived to me in the wrong direction: long axis L--R. You need to turn base 90degrees. 1. Turn cane upside down 2. Remove center screw completely with Allen wrench 3. Place cane on floor like you would use it. 4. Straddle the plastic base with both of your feet, holding it tight. 5. Now using cane handle, just forcibly turn it 90degrees. Now base is aligned correctly, front-back. 6. Turn cane upside down again. 7. Replace set center screw and tight with Allen wrench. Good to go now.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: I do like the design
customer_reviews.text: Broke my ankle and needed something to assist my balance. Not as stable as I thought it would be. Took a few days to get used to. I think the biggest issue that this cane poses is the difficulty it has to stand on it's own. If you do not focus on how you let go of it, it does fall. I could definitely see this being an issue for an older person who may have difficulty bending over or squatting. I do like the design. Maybe if it was a bit weighted at the bottom it could solve several of these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Oily grip handle
customer_reviews.text: It’s been 18 months since my purchase and I had no complaints till now. Why has the rubber grip handle all of a sudden become oily? I washed it in hot water and soap and by morning it’s oily again. Has anyone else come across this problem.
customer_reviews.author: hwncrsdncr

customer_reviews.title: Stable Cane
customer_reviews.text: When I had problems with my knee, I had a long wait to see the ortho doc. I felt I needed some stability while I was trying to get around. Not wanting to do a lot of walking, to find a cane, I turned to my favorite on-line store: Amazon.com. This cane has a broad tip, so it stands on its own, if necessary. It is adjustable, height-wise. The handle is most comfortable to grip and it has a strap. Most importantly, it's in a great color! lol ;D All this for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Dowd

customer_reviews.title: Able
customer_reviews.text: It has a small footprint but that's why i bought it. Got me through the recovery.
customer_reviews.author: E. M. Schley

product_meta.title: Hugo Mobility Quadpod Offset Cane with Ultra Stable Cane Tip, Smoke
product_meta.description:
Color:SmokeQuadPod Canes by Hugo are everything you want in a cane and much more. These height adjustable, smoke QuadPod Canes can accommodate most people between 5' - 6'.5" and are durable, versatile and stylish. The Hugo QuadPod Cane features an Ultra Stable Cane Tip which is 54% lighter & 80% more compact than a large base quad cane. It’s unique quad design recenters itself for maximum stability and allows your cane to stand independently. Hugo QuadPod Canes incorporate push buttons to provide 12 precision height settings, supporting up to 300 lbs. The ergonomic, shock absorbing cushion-top cane handle is designed to fit more comfortably in your hand and has a reflective strap for added night time safety. This Hugo mobility aid is manufactured of heavy-gauge anodized aluminum to provide durability while being light weight. Model # 731-858


Specifications

 * Weight Capacity: 300 lbs.
 * Fits Most People Between: 5' - 6'5"
 * Handle Height Adjustments (handle to floor): 2'4" - 3'3"
 * Item Weight: 1.4 lbs.
 * Assembled Dimensions (open): 1.0" x 1.0" x 28.5"
feature_bullets: This smoke QuadPod Cane is height adjustable and can accommodate most people between 5' 6'.5". Height adjustable from 71 to 99 cm
The Hugo QuadPod Cane features an Ultra Stable Cane Tip which is 54 percent lighter and 80 percent more compact than a large base quad cane
It’s unique quad design recenters itself for maximum stability and allows your cane to stand independently
Hugo QuadPod Canes incorporate push buttons to provide 12 precision height settings, supporting up to 300 lbs
The ergonomic, shock absorbing cushion top cane handle is designed to fit more comfortably in your hand and has a reflective strap for added night time safety

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
